intro: Aragallus nothoxys, commonly known as the narrow-leaved aragallus, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually greenish-white in color, which bloom in late summer. Native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, it thrives in rocky and arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
